title: To the Graces
lines: Hear me, O illustrious, O renowned Graces, daughters of Zeus and full-bosomed Eunomia, Aglaia, Thalia, blessed Euphrosyne, lovely, wise, and pure mothers of joy, many-shaped, ever-blooming, beloved of mortals.
We pray that each in her turn with a flower's beauty on her face, enchanting, come, ever gentle, to the initiates to bring them prosperity.
